subtasks: Timing garlic planting in mid-October
Preparing soil by covering it with a fall living cover crop
Driving a custom-built cart through heavy cover crop for planting
Adjusting the back tension for mulching and covering the planted garlic
Conserving soil moisture through mulching and mechanical planters
Managing cover crop growth using natural methods like winterkill
Applying foliar feed and calcium supplements for plant health
Harvesting garlic in July when third of the plants have browning foliage
Sharing knowledge and experiences through grant-funded research and community engagement

tasks.task: Constructing and designing a custom garlic planting cart
subtasks: Collaborating with Purdue University students to design a suitable cart
Addressing challenges with existing commercially available planting carts
Prioritizing a small-scale, medium-sized, and efficient mechanical system
Incorporating features for traversing heavy cover crops and integrating with current farming practices
Ensuring the cart can be built locally and maintained independently

tasks.task: Operating agricultural equipment for multiple tasks
subtasks: Using irrigation systems for watering crops
Adjusting rows for planting and harvesting using shanks or tillers
Managing tillage and soil conservation techniques (rototilling, strip tilling, shank ripping)
Utilizing drip tape for efficient irrigation
Planting garlic seedlings with hand tools and carts
Managing multiple garlic varieties and crop rotations
Marketing and selling seed garlic through a website and social media
Engaging with customers via pre-sales and maintaining a steady supply
